title: How to Adjust Your Facebook Privacy Settings

steps.title: Navigate to the Privacy Checkup page.
steps.content: Navigate to the Privacy Checkup page. Privacy Checkup is a Facebook feature that will quickly walk you through all the privacy features and allow you to make quick changes to them. You can find more Privacy settings in the Settings menu and/or Privacy Center. You can find the Privacy Checkup option at the top of the Settings menu. Use the following steps to open the Privacy Checkup page: Click or tap your profile image or menu button. Click or tap Settings & Privacy . On mobile, you can skip this step and tap the Gear icon in the upper-right corner. Click or tap Settings . Click or tap Privacy Checkup .

steps.title: Manage who can see what you share.
steps.content: Manage who can see what you share. The first option in the Privacy Checkup page allows you to manage who can see what you post on Facebook. You can find more options to control who can see your content in the Audience Settings menu . Use the following steps to manage these options: Click or tap Who can see what you share . Click or tap Continue . Click or tap the drop-down menu next to one of the items on your profile page. Select who can see that item. Click or tap Next when you have made adjustments to all items. Click or tap the drop-down menu next to "Default audience." Select who can see your posts by default. You can adjust your audience settings for individual posts as you post them. Click or tap the drop-down menu next to "Stories." Select who can see your stories by default. Click or tap Done . Click or tap Limit to limit your past posts to "Friends only." Click or tap Next . Click or tap See your blocked list to see who you've blocked. Click or tap Add to blocked list to block someone. Enter the name of the person you want to block. Click or tap Block next to the person you want to block. Click or tap Next Click or tap Review Another Topic .

steps.title: Manage how people can find you on Facebook.
steps.content: Manage how people can find you on Facebook. The next topic on the list allows you to review your friend requests, manage who can see your email address and phone number, as well as control whether or not your profile appears in search engines outside of Facebook. You can find more options in the "How people can find and contact you" menu . Use the following steps to manage how people find you on Facebook. Click or tap How people can find you on Facebook . Click or tap Continue . Click or tap Confirm or Delete next to any pending friend requests. Click or tap the drop-down menu next to "People with your phone number." Select who can see your phone number on your profile and click Done . Click or tap the drop-down menu next to "People with your email address." Select who can see your email address on your profile and click Done . Click or tap Next . Click or tap the toggle switch to allow or disallow your profile to appear in search engines outside of Facebook (i.e. Google and Bing). Click or tap Next Click or tap Review Another Topic .

steps.title: Manage your account security.
steps.content: Manage your account security. The "How to keep your account secure" topic allows you to manage your password and two-factor authentication settings. Use the following steps to manage your account security: Click or tap How to keep your account secure . Click or tap Continue . Click or tap Change password if you want to change your password. Enter your old password in the top bar. Enter a new password twice in the next two bars. Click or tap Save Changes . Click or tap Next . Click or tap Manage to open your two-factor authentication settings in the Account Center. Click or tap the toggle switches next to each method to control how you receive alerts. Click or tap Next . Click or tap Review Another Topic .

steps.title: Manage websites you use Facebook to log in to.
steps.content: Manage websites you use Facebook to log in to. The "Your data settings on Facebook" topic allows you to review which websites and apps you've used your Facebook login to create an account with and log into as well as remove logins you no longer want to use. Use the following steps to review what websites and apps you use Facebook to log in to: Click or tap Your Data Settings on Facebook . Click or tap Continue . Click or tap Remove next to any websites you've used Facebook to log into that you don't want to use anymore. Click or tap Next . Click or tap Review Another Topic .

steps.title: Manage your ad preferences on Facebook.
steps.content: Manage your ad preferences on Facebook. The "Your ad preferences on Facebook" topic allows you to manage how Facebook uses your information to target you with ads and who can see your social interactions alongside ads. You can find more ad settings in the "Add Preferences" menu . Use the following steps to manage your ad preferences: Click or tap Your ad preferences on Facebook . Click or tap Continue . Review the information and click or tap Next . Click or tap the toggle switch next to the profile items you want to allow or disallow Facebook to use in targeted advertising. Click or tap Next . Scroll down and click or tap the drop-down menu next to "Who can see your social interactions alongside ads." Select "Friends" or "Only me." Click or tap Next Click or tap Review Another Topic .

steps.title: Access your Audience Settings menu.
steps.content: Access your Audience Settings menu. The Audience Settings menu allows you to change who can view your Facebook profile information, as well as adjust who can see the content you post. Use the following steps to access the Audience Settings menu: [1] X Research source Click or tap your profile icon or the menu button. Click or tap Settings & Privacy . On mobile, you can skip this step by tapping Privacy Center instead. Scroll down and click or tap Privacy Center . Click or tap Review Settings . Scroll down and click or tap Manage audience settings .

steps.title: Adjust who can see your profile information.
steps.content: Adjust who can see your profile information. Your profile information contains information that includes your phone number, email address, birthday, hometown, relationship status, work, education, your friends list, and the people and pages you follow. You can set each of these items to Public (everyone can see them), Friends (only your Facebook friends), Only me (no one except you can see), Close friends (people you mark as a close friend), Specific friends, or Friends except (friends that you choose). Use the following steps to adjust who can see your profile information from the Audience Settings menu: Click or tap Profile information . Click or tap an item in the list of profile information. Click or tap a preferred audience setting. Select specific friends (if the option allows it.) Click or tap Save . Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Adjust who can see your posts.
steps.content: Adjust who can see your posts. You can change your audience settings for your posts, stories, or reels. You can set your audience settings for posts to Public (everyone can see them), Friends (only your Facebook friends), Only me (no one except you can see your posts), Close friends (people you mark as a close friend), Specific friends, or Friends except (friends that you choose). Use the following steps to adjust who can see your posts from the Audience Settings menu: Click or tap Posts and stories . Click or tap Who can see your future posts? Click or tap a preferred audience setting. Select friends from the list (if the option you select allows it). Click or tap Save . Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Adjust who can see your stories.
steps.content: Adjust who can see your stories. Facebook Stories are the pictures and short videos that appear above your feed from people you follow on Facebook. Unlike posts, you can only set the visibility of your stories to "Public," "Friends," or "Custom" (a custom list of friends). Use the following steps to adjust who can see your stories from the Audience Settings menu: Click or tap Posts and stories . Click or tap Who can see your stories . Click or tap a preferred audience setting. Click or tap Save . Select a list of friends (if you selected "Custom.") Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Adjust who can view your reels.
steps.content: Adjust who can view your reels. Reels are the longer vertical-form videos that appear in the Reels section on Facebook. You can set the visibility of your reels to "Public," "Friends," or "Friends except" (with a list of friends who are excluded from seeing your reel.) Use the following steps to adjust who can see your reels from the Audience Settings menu: Click or tap Posts and stories . Click or tap Reels can appear in Feed, Video and other places across Facebook . Click or tap a preferred audience setting. Select friends to exclude (if you selected "Friends except.") Click or tap Save . Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Limit your past posts to Friends Only.
steps.content: Limit your past posts to Friends Only. Limiting your past posts changes any posts that were once set to allow the "Public" or "Friends of Friends" to see your posts to Friends only. Use the following steps to limit your past posts from the Audience Settings menu: Click or tap Posts and stories . Scroll down and tap Limit next to "Limit posts posts to only friends."

steps.title: Click or tap your profile icon or the menu button.
steps.content: Click or tap your profile icon or the menu button. It's in the upper-right corner on Android and desktop computer. On iPhone and iPad, it's in the lower-right corner. You can set your Facebook settings so that when people tag you, you have to review their tags before they appear on your Facebook profile. You can do this for both Facebook and Instagram. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Click or tap Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Click or tap Settings & Privacy . It's in the menu that appears when you click your profile image. On mobile, you can skip this step by tapping Privacy Center .

steps.title: Scroll down and click or tap Privacy Center.
steps.content: Scroll down and click or tap Privacy Center . This opens the Privacy Center, which contains various privacy shortcuts to your privacy settings.

steps.title: Click or tap Review Settings.
steps.content: Click or tap Review Settings . It's the large blue button in the center of the page. This opens the Common Privacy Settings menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and click or tap Manage audience settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and click or tap Manage audience settings . It's at the bottom of the "Audience Settings" box.

steps.title: Click or tap Review tags before they appear on your profile.
steps.content: Click or tap Review tags before they appear on your profile . This allows you to manage what happens when you are tagged in a post.

steps.title: Click or tap the toggle switch next to "Review tags before they appear on your profile."
steps.content: Click or tap the toggle switch next to "Review tags before they appear on your profile." When this is turned on, you will be notified when you are tagged in a post. You will need to review the tag and approve it before it appears on your profile.

steps.title: Click or tap the checkbox next to the accounts you want to apply this to.
steps.content: Click or tap the checkbox next to the accounts you want to apply this to. You can apply this to both your Facebook and Instagram accounts.

steps.title: Click or tap Close.
steps.content: Click or tap Close . This closes the window.

steps.title: Click or tap your profile icon or menu button.
steps.content: Click or tap your profile icon or menu button. On Android and computers, it's in the upper-right corner. On iPhone and iPad, it's in the lower-right corner. You can control who can search and contact you in the Settings menu.

steps.title: Click or tap Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Click or tap Settings & Privacy . It's in the menu that appears when you click your profile image.

steps.title: Click or tap Settings.
steps.content: Click or tap Settings . This opens the Settings menu. On desktop computer, it will appear in the menu bar to the left.

steps.title: Scroll down and click or tap How people find and contact you.
steps.content: Scroll down and click or tap How people find and contact you . This menu allows you to control how people can search for you and contact you on Facebook.

steps.title: Select who can send you friend requests.
steps.content: Select who can send you friend requests. Your options are "Everyone" or "Friends of Friends." If you select "Everyone", anyone can send you a friend request. If you select "Friends of Friends", then only people who are friends with people you are Facebook friends with can send you a friend request. Use the following steps to select who can send you friend requests: Click or tap Who can send you friend requests? . Select one of the options. Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Select who can see your friends list}.
steps.content: Select who can see your friends list}. You can manage who can see who you are friends with. Your options are "Public" (everyone can see them), "Friends" (only your Facebook friends), "Only me" (no one except you can see your friends list), "Close friends" (people you mark as a close friend), "Specific friends", or "Friends except" (friends that you choose). Mutual friends can always see each other, no matter what your audience settings are. Use the following steps to select who can see your friends list: Click or tap Who can see your friends list? . Select one of the options. Select a list of friends and click or tap Save (if the option allows it). Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Select who can see your email address.
steps.content: Select who can see your email address. Your options include "Possible Contacts" (i.e. people who have your email address in their contacts), "Friends of friends" (your Facebook friends and their friends), "Friends" (only your Facebook friends), or "No one." Use the following steps to select who can see your email address: Click or tap People with your email address . Select one of the options. Select a list of friends and click or tap Save (if the option allows it). Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Select who you want to allow to see your phone number.
steps.content: Select who you want to allow to see your phone number. Your options include "Possible Contacts" (i.e. people who have your email address in their contacts), "Friends of friends" (your Facebook friends and their friends), "Friends" (only your Facebook friends), or "No one." Use the following steps to select who can see your phone number: Click or tap People with your phone number . Select one of the options. Select a list of friends and click or tap Save (if the option allows it). Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Select if your profile is searchable outside of Facebook.
steps.content: Select if your profile is searchable outside of Facebook. To do so, click or tap the toggle switch next to "Do you want search engines outside of Facebook to link to your profile?." If this feature is on, your Facebook profile can appear in the searches on search engines outside of Facebook, like Google or Bing. To make your Facebook profile not searchable in search engines, turn this feature off.

steps.title: Lock your profile if the option is available.
steps.content: Lock your profile if the option is available. In some countries, you can lock your profile as a quick and easy way to make it private. According to online security expert Naveh Ben Dror, if you choose this option, only your friends will be able to see your profile and posts, even if they were public in the past. If locking is available in your area, you can do it by going to your profile, clicking or tapping ••• near the top of the page, and selecting Lock Profile .

steps.title: Click or tap your profile icon or menu button.
steps.content: Click or tap your profile icon or menu button. On Android and computer, it's in the upper-right corner. On iPhone and iPad, it's in the lower-right corner. The "Followers and public content" menu allows you to control who can follow you, who can see your followers, who can see the people pages, and lists that you follow, as well as who can comment on your public posts.

steps.title: Click or tap Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Click or tap Settings & Privacy . It's in the menu that appears when you click your profile image.

steps.title: Click or tap Settings.
steps.content: Click or tap Settings . This opens the Settings menu. On computer, it will appear in the menu bar to the left.

steps.title: Click or tap Followers and public content.
steps.content: Click or tap Followers and public content . This menu allows you to select who can follow you and who can see your followers.

steps.title: Select who is allowed to follow you.
steps.content: Select who is allowed to follow you. Your options are "Public," "Friends," "Only Me," "Custom," or "Close Friends." If you have professional mode turned on, you can only pick "Public". To change this, you need to turn professional mode off. Use the following steps to select who is allowed to follow you: Click or tap Who can follow me . Select one of the options. Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Click or tap Who can see your followers on your timeline?.
steps.content: Click or tap Who can see your followers on your timeline? . This allows you to select who can see your followers.

steps.title: Select who can see your followers.
steps.content: Select who can see your followers. Your options are "Public," "Friends," "Only Me", "Custom," or "Close Friends." Use the following steps to select who can see your followers: Click or tap Who can see your followers on your timeline? . Select one of the options. Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Select who can see the people, Pages, and lists you follow.
steps.content: Select who can see the people, Pages, and lists you follow. Your options are "Public," "Friends," "Only Me," "Friends except," "Specific Friends," "Custom," or "Close Friends." Use the following steps to select who can see the people, Pages, and lists you follow: Click or tap Who can see the people Pages and lists you follow? . Select one of the options. Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Click or tap Who can comment on your public posts?.
steps.content: Click or tap Who can comment on your public posts? . This allows you to select who can comment on posts that you mark as "Public" in the audience settings.

steps.title: Select who can comment on your public posts.
steps.content: Select who can comment on your public posts. Your options are "Friends," "Friends of friends," or "Public." Use the following steps to select who can comment on your public posts: Click or tap Who can comment on your public posts? . Select one of the options.

steps.title: Select who can like or comment on your public profile information.
steps.content: Select who can like or comment on your public profile information. Your options are "Friends," "Friends of friends," or "Public." Use the following steps to select who can comment on your public profile information: Click or tap Public profile info . Select one of the options. Click or tap Done .

steps.title: Open the Facebook mobile app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook mobile app. Your active status shows other Facebook users when you are active on Facebook. You can turn this feature on or off using the Facebook mobile app. Currently, this option is not available on a desktop computer.

steps.title: Tap your profile icon or menu button.
steps.content: Tap your profile icon or menu button. It's in the upper-right corner on Android, or in the lower-right corner on iPhone and iPad.

steps.title: Tap the Gear icon.
steps.content: Tap the Gear icon. It's in the upper right corner. This opens the Settings menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Active Status.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Active Status . This displays a toggle switch that allows you to turn your active status on or off.

steps.title: Tap the toggle switch.
steps.content: Tap the toggle switch. This turns your active status on or off.

steps.title: Open the "Ad preferences" menu.
steps.content: Open the "Ad preferences" menu. Facebook uses target advertising, where they use information from your profile, account activity, and even some websites you visit outside of Facebook to target you with specific ads that are tailored to your interests. The Ad Preferences menu allows you to manage how Facebook can use your information to target you with advertising. Use the following steps to open the Ad Preferences menu: Click or tap your profile icon or the menu button. Click or tap Settings & privacy . Click or tap Settings . Click or tap Account Center . Click or tap Ad preferences Click or tap the Manage info tab at the top.

steps.title: Select what profile information can be used in target ads.
steps.content: Select what profile information can be used in target ads. This allows you to select what information on your profile can be used in target advertising. Use the following steps to select what profile information can be used: Click or tap Categories used to reach you on the "Ad preferences" page. Click or tap the items on your profile. Click or tap Yes or No to select if that information is allowed to target you with ads.

steps.title: Turn targeted advertising on or off.
steps.content: Turn targeted advertising on or off. This allows you to manage if information gathered from websites you visit off Facebook can be used in targeted advertising. Use the following steps to manage targeted advertising. Click or tap Activity information from ad partners on the "Ad preferences" page. Click or tap Review Settings . Click or tap the Yes or No to turn targeted advertising on or off.

steps.title: Manage ads shown outside of Meta/Facebook.
steps.content: Manage ads shown outside of Meta/Facebook. In addition to the ads you see on Facebook, other companies may use information from Meta to show you ads in their own apps. Use the following steps to allow or disallow third-party apps to show you ads from Meta Services in their own apps: Click or tap Ads shown outside of Meta . Select Allow to allow Meta to show ads in other apps, or select Don't allow to not allow Meta to show ads in other apps.

steps.title: Open the Settings menu.
steps.content: Open the Settings menu. You can manage access to your location data in the Settings menu on Android devices. Use the following steps to open the Settings menu: [3] X Research source Swipe down from the top of the screen. Tap the Gear icon in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Tap Apps.
steps.content: Tap Apps . This menu allows you to manage your installed apps and their permission settings.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Facebook.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Facebook . It should be in your list of apps.

steps.title: Tap Permissions.
steps.content: Tap Permissions . This menu allows you to manage what features of your phone Facebook can access.

steps.title: Tap Locations.
steps.content: Tap Locations . This allows you to manage access to your location data

steps.title: Select one of the options.
steps.content: Select one of the options. The options are as follows: Allow only while using the app: This allows Facebook to access your location data while you are using Facebook. Ask every time: This requires Facebook to ask your permission to access your locations every time it wants to access your location data. Don't allow: This blocks Facebook from accessing your location data.

steps.title: Open the Settings app .
steps.content: Open the Settings app . It has an icon that resembles two silver gears. Tap the Settings app on your Home screen.

steps.title: Tap Apps (iOS 16 only).
steps.content: Tap Apps (iOS 16 only). If you are using the latest version of iOS, tap Apps to display a list of apps you have installed on your iPhone.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Facebook.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Facebook . This allows you to manage what features Facebook has access to on your phone.

steps.title: Tap Location.
steps.content: Tap Location . It's next to a blue icon with an image that resembles a compass needle.

steps.title: Select one of the options.
steps.content: Select one of the options. The options are as follows: While Using the App: This allows Facebook to access your location data whenever you are using it. Ask Next Time Or When I Share: This requires Facebook to ask permission whenever it wants to access your location data. Never: This blocks Facebook from accessing your location data.
